intro: Holosteum umbellatum var. glaberrimum, commonly known as the smooth umbellate holosteum, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features slender, ascending stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are usually smooth and hairless. Its flowers are usually violet or blue in color, arranged in umbellate clusters, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
